math_problem: Let $Q(x)=x^{2}+2x+3$, and suppose that $P(x)$ is a polynomial such that $P(Q(x))=x^{6}+6x^{5}+18x^{4}+32x^{3}+35x^{2}+22x+8$. Let $k = Q(r) - 1$, where $r$ is the unique real root of the derivative of $Q$. Does there exist an irrational number $\alpha>k$ such that $\left\lfloor\alpha^{n}\right\rfloor \equiv 0 \quad(\bmod 2017)$ for all integers $n \geq k$ ?
